experiences.title: Senior HR Business Partner, HR4HR

experiences.description:
I served as a trusted advisor and SME in the area of Global Diversity & Inclusion, guiding my clients in the development and execution of their D&I strategy and creation of their D&I plan. Roles & responsibilities included, but were not limited to the following:
- Provide consultation to senior business and HR leaders to drive measurable impact versus activity in alignment with the company's overarching GD&I strategy.  
- Develop strong strategic partnerships with client aligned HR teams and other centers of excellence (talent acquisition, learning & development, talent management) to drive execution of the D&I plan for the business. 
- Partner with HR teams and business aligned diversity leads and/or champs to leverage existing resources and/or design programming as needed. This includes facilitation of trainings & discussions to drive awareness in the D&I space. 
- Provide data insights, identifying focus areas and suggested actions to address concerns and drive improvement. 

This role required strong consultation skills, the ability to influence, a willingness to stay apprised of best practices and current research, and a true growth mindset as Global Diversity & Inclusion is an ever-evolving space. 

During my first year and a half with Microsoft I was also responsible for the relaunch and management of our women's Employee Resource Group, Women@Microsoft. Sr. Global D&I Manager, CELA
experiences.title: Sr. Global D&I Manager, CELA

experiences.description:
Role entailed use of data analytics and research to provide insight into emerging diversity issues. I worked closely with key partners in talent, recruitment, leadership development, & extended HR teams in order to deliver thought leadership, recommend solutions, and deploy programs designed to recruit, hire, develop, & retain a diverse workforce worldwide. 

Best practice sharing was accomplished through regular collaboration with other BU Diversity Partners so that successful programs could be shared enterprise wide in order to deliver and execute on IBM's strategic imperatives and commitment to diversity. Business Unit Diversity & Inclusion Partner Jan 2014 - Jul 2015 · 1 yr 7 mos
experiences.title: Business Unit Diversity & Inclusion Partner

experiences.description:
Responsible for management of Diversity compliance requirements for MEA, CEE, & GCG. Key responsibilities included but were not limited to:
- Deep level of understanding of the country legislative requirements for Diversity compliance
- Working with Diversity Country Focal Points, Legal, Recruitment, Compensation, Offboarding, and Talent teams to manage country compliance 
- Facilitate country compliance through reviews – MSA, Peer Reviews, fines / reasons, and audit documentation, to help ensure satisfactory compliance standing
- Facilitate compliance mitigation planning to remediate gaps, existing fines, or marginal / unsatisfactory ratings
- Support government audits, when applicable

Additional responsibilities included: 
- Reviewer and team lead for global business controls reviews of IBM international locations, including both remote and on-site reviews.
- Various projects requiring design and/or data analysis including but not limited to:
o Data and project management for corporate diversity initiatives
o Research and compilation of business relevant demographics for global markets.
o Development of online community to facilitate global collaboration. Diversity Compliance Leader - Middle East & Africa, Central & Eastern Europe, & Greater China Group
experiences.title: Diversity Compliance Leader - Middle East & Africa, Central & Eastern Europe, & Greater China Group

experiences.description:
• Conduct monthly data retrieval, data integrity, and report creation for Equal Opportunity compliance tracking.
• Reviewer and team lead for global business controls reviews of IBM international locations, including both remote and on-site reviews.

o Focus group design, facilitation, and data analysis.
o Assessment and analysis of performance management data.
o Assessment and analysis of global selection systems.
o Research and compilation of business relevant demographics for global markets.
o Development of online community to facilitate global collaboration. Global EO & Compliance Diversity Analyst Oct 2010 - Jan 2012 · 1 yr 4 mos
experiences.title: Global EO & Compliance Diversity Analyst

experiences.description:
•	Evaluated human resources policies as stated in the organization’s employee handbook and revised policies to reflect current organizational goals
•	Ensured new organizational policies were consistent with all state and federal employment law
•	Evaluated current job descriptions and updated as necessary
•	Redesigned employee evaluation process to reflect updated job descriptions, organizational policies & organizational goals

experiences.title: Independent Consultant

experiences.description:
•Taught two sections of Experimental Psychology lab (undergraduate psychology statistics). 
•Trained students on use of the Minitab statistical analysis program.
•Taught students hand calculations for statistical tests.
•Created and graded quizzes, labs, homework, and lab lessons. 
•Taught lecture for professor when needed.
experiences.title: Graduate Teaching Assistant

experiences.description:
•Attended structured interview training at the Aspen Institute office in Washington, DC.
•Conducted structured interviews for the MicroTest survey in the SCWBC. 
•Additional MicroTest activities included collecting and entering client intake information, and entering and cleaning the data in the MicroTest survey spreadsheet as well as the WebCats database used by the organization. 
•Developed new methods for collecting, entering, and analyzing client information to be implemented in all SC satellite offices.
•Conducted training sessions with current employees on new data collection methods.  
•Developed employee guidelines for client outreach to match the organization’s shift toward including more clients from rural areas to be implemented in all SC satellite offices.
•Conducted training sessions with current employees on new client outreach guidelines.
experiences.title: CITI Foundation-Aspen Institute MicroTest Intern
